page.title: 07FISHING IN THE RIVER TEME.
page.content: The River Teme meanders eastwards across the Southern half of our area and joins the Severn just beyond. Its flat floodplain is wide and the river flows between steep banks, bordered by alders and willows.Water level and speed are very variable, quickly reflecting the weather conditions upstream,but the uneven river bed offers deep pools for salmon trout,chub,roach & perch. Proximity to Worcester makes fishing very popular & local angling clubs own the fishing rights along most stretches.Worcester Metropolitan Police,St Johns Working Mens Club and Worcester & District United Anglers Assoc all have private fishing here. Day permits can be obtained from the Severn & Trent River Authority to fish from the Old Weir;just upstream from Old Powick Bridge.
